page.title: 06HAND-BLOCK PRINTING
page.content: This is about one of our local firms. At{Edward Turnbull's Edenwood Mill} they do block and screen printing.The present company was formed in 1969. It is the only place in Europe where hand-block printing is done.The material is laid on a 50 metre table. Each individual block is used only for one colour and each one put on separately.Sometimes over two hundred blocks can be used to print one pattern.A screen is like a large mesh window with the pattern cut out;paint is wiped across and so the pattern prints on the cloth. A process unique to the works is the 'Magic Box' which fixes the colour into the cloth so that when washed it will not run.Because the cloth takes so long to print it is very expensive to buy.
